ISSUE.TITLE: 'git describe --tags $(git rev-list --tags --max-count=1)' may return beta version
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Change Type Correction ### Area Installation/upgrade ### Proposed Changes In 'https://github.com/netbox-community/netbox/blob/main/docs/installation/upgrading.md#option-b-check-out-a-git-release', the user is advised to use `git describe --tags $(git rev-list --tags --max-count=1)` Currently, this returns 'v4.3.0-beta1', which is probably not what the user wants. This is particularly bad if a script/playbook is used for updates.

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Closes #19208: Ignore beta releases when fetching latest release tag
Closes #19208: Ignore beta releases when fetching latest release tag
